message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the reconstruction of sparse signals from a reduced set of samples, which is a common problem in signal processing and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes an adaptive gradient-based algorithm for the recovery of missing samples, which falls under cs.SP (Signal Processing) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). The paper also presents a new criterion for parameter adaptation, which can be considered as a machine learning approach and falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper considers the case of nonuniformly sampled signals, which falls under cs.SI (Sound and Image Processing).
